titleStmt.title: The declaration and address of the gentry of the county of Essex, who have adhered to the King, and suffered imprisonment, or sequestration, during the late troubles.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Gabriel Bedell, and Thomas Collins, at the middle Temple-gate in Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: "A letter dated Chelmsford, April 17, enclosing the declaration and hoping for peace. A declaration that they entertain no thought of revenge and submit to the resolution of the next Parliament for a settlement of Church and State." -- Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
